title: The Edge of Destruction
dialogue_triumphs: We've had time taken away from us, and now it's being given back because it's running out.
dialogue_disasters: You'd be blown to atoms by a split second!
goofs: William Hartnell says the same line ('It's not very likely') twice
William Hartnell fumbles 'You knocked both Susan and I unconscious'
William Hartnell omits the scripted explanation for the melted clocks
'Fast Return' (in English) appears to be written on the TARDIS console in felt-tip

The Doctor receiving a coat from Gilbert and Sullivan
additional_notes: Susan and the Doctor appear to have a telepathic link with each other and the TARDIS. The Doctor's unfamiliarity with the TARDIS and delayed realization of the problem suggest he may not be fully acquainted with all its functions.
bottom_line: 'The Edge of Destruction' manages to flesh out the central figures at the expense of the plot.
